original:
The positioning of the spindle apparatus in symmetrically and asymmetrically dividing cells during early embryonic development is regulated by mechanical forces, which are mediated by the microtubule and actin microfilament systems. Local variations in physical forces and mechanical cues, such as the stiffness of the extracellular matrix (ECM), also influence gene expression critical to the developmental process of blastulation.

A nota
